title: Watch: All out CHAOS erupts at a Chinese restaurant, with chairs and hot bowls of soup flying everywhere
description:
Let the lefties in your life know you fight like hell with the classic FIGHT LIKE HELL tee! Buy the shirt at CrowderShop.com.

Shout out to our Jewish readers who will be enjoying Chinese food with a movie while the rest of us are celebrating the birth of Jesus. On behalf of everyone here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website, we suggest a) seeing The Iron Claw, and b) being careful.

It was on sight at... I don't know where this is. A Chinese restaurant somewhere on the planet. Where things were said, one thing led to another, and a bowl of hot water was thrown at someone. Never before have so few f*cks been squeezed into such a short clip.

title: Watch: Man who looks like Santa GOES OFF on "stupid democrats" and all the dumb ideas they have that aren't good
description:
Are you a defiant American? Buy the shirt at CrowderShop.com!

Okay, OBVIOUSLY this is not the real Santa Claus. Santa is busy in December. He can't sneak off to California in his pickup to buy bananas. He's got elves to do that. Our friend here merely shares Santa characteristics. We'll call him Sam T. Claus. Sam has some things to say about Democrats.

He doesn't like them. They're stupid. And their ideas are not very good.

— (@)

Dumb ideas like California mandating all cars be electric.

title: Watch: Trudeau's conservative opponent declares he'll "defund the media" with a smile and to thunderous applause
description:
Are you really defending liberty without your LWC Defend Liberty hoodie? Get yours at CrowderShop.com!

Pierre Poilievre is the conservative alternative to Prime Minster Justin "I Feel Pretty" Trudeau. Maybe. Trudeau, Canada's walking pile of soy and hair goop, only gets around 33% of the Canadian vote, but because of the stoonad way Canadians vote, he adds that to other candidates and becomes Prime Minister somehow. This is what countries get for not having a two-party system like a proper country.
